definition: to accompany sb/to accompany each other
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
partner/companion/comrade/associate/to accompany

sentences.english: Everything is sleeping now, expect the clock and me.
sentences.chinese: 现在，除了钟与我相伴，一切都在沉睡着。

sentences.english: In Changshu, Jiangsu province, the chestnut trees and osmanthus trees are planted together, so the chestnut has the flavor of osmanthus.
sentences.chinese: 江苏常熟栗树与桂树相伴生长，所产栗子有桂花香味。

sentences.english: The primitive dance also has the metre which raps or sings toaccompany with.
sentences.chinese: 原始的舞蹈也有敲击出来的节拍或歌唱相伴和。

sentences.english: The third, the one you should not accompany,so then you may not owe .
sentences.chinese: 第三最好不相伴，如此便可不相欠。

sentences.english: Becduse I couldn't live a day without you.
sentences.chinese: 因为没有你的相伴，我一天都无法苟活。

sentences.english: No Road is too long with good company.
sentences.chinese: 有好友一路相伴，长途也不显遥远。

sentences.english: They were together until they died.
sentences.chinese: 他们相守相伴一直到死。

sentences.english: Ever green mountains verdure the accompanying distance between us.
sentences.chinese: 青山不老翠绿着我们相知相伴的距离。

sentences.english: These two words were usually coupled together in the Old Pink Dog Bar.
sentences.chinese: 在“粉色老狗”酒吧里，这两个字经常是相伴出现的。

sentences.english: Behind bad luck comes good luck.
We are left in awe by the extreme poverty as well as the extreme wealth.
sentences.chinese: 极端贫困和极端富有相伴而生，让我们不胜唏嘘。

sentences.english: A red dream millennium, a lonely world song.
sentences.chinese: 红尘一梦醉千年，寂寞一世歌相伴。

sentences.english: Tearful smile, swallowed by the darkness.
Here I pray for them for health.
sentences.chinese: 在此祈愿健康重新相伴她们。

sentences.english: Through howling winds and driving rains, To be by your side.
sentences.chinese: 顶着那疾风暴雨，我与你相伴。

definition: to walk hand in hand/to cooperate
to be interdependent
to accompany/to keep sb company
to accompany
from dawn to dusk/all the time
to stand by (sb) (idiom)/steadfast loyalty
to stay together/to rely on one another
lit. body and shadow follow each other (idiom)/fig. inseparable
to moisten with spittle (idiom); sharing meager resources/mutual help in humble circumstances
to meet together/to assemble
lit. in the same boat under wind and rain (idiom); fig. to stick together in hard times
to constantly have (sb or sth) on one's mind
happiness/happy/blessed
to meet
hand in hand and shoulder to shoulder
to grow old together
